intro: Arundoclaytonia dissimilis, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking pink or red flowers. The plant has a short, fibrous root system and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Arundoclaytonia dissimilis is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
